All Classes

  • All Classes Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    Controller
    Superclass for all controllers.
    CreateNewTest1Controller
    This controller class handles GET and POST requests to the /create_new_test_1 page.
    CreateNewTest2Controller
    Controller for the /create_new_test_2 page.
    DatabaseStorage
    JDBC-based implementation of PersistentStorage that uses a MariaDB/MySQL database for storage.
    DeleteTestController
    Controller for GET requests to the /delete_test page, used to delete tests that have already been created.
    GetQuestionsController
    Controller for GET requests to the /get_questions page.
    HashedPassword
    A class that represents the binary data of a hashed password.
    IndexController
    Controller for the / and /index pages.
    LoginController
    Controller for the /login page for logging users in.
    Main  
    PasswordSecurity
    Class for securely verifying and hashing passwords.
    PersistentStorage
    Abstract class that represents the "persistent layer" of the application, storing everything (tests, users, answers, etc.) that must be permanently saved.
    RenderQuestionController
    Controller to handle GET requests to /render_question.
    RenderTestController
    Controller to serve GET requests to the /render_test page.
    SecurityParameters
    Sets the number of hash iterations and hash/salt sizes of the password hashing/salting algorithm.
    SignoutController
    Controller for /signout, used to sign users out of their accounts.
    SignupController
    Controller for the /signup page.
    StudentAnswerFileController
    Controller for the /student_answer_file page, used to get the raw PDF data of previously-uploaded student answer files.
    Test  
    TestController
    Controller for the /test page (not to be confused with the /tests page).
    TestFile  
    TestQuestion  
    TestQuestion.CanvasRectangle  
    TestsController
    Controller for the /tests page.
    UploadStudentAnswersController  
    UserPermission
